00032 // Test the DAS class.
00033 // Read attributes from one or more files, printing the resulting table to
00034 // stdout. If a file is named `-' read from stdin for that file. The option
00035 // `-d' causes new/delete run-time debugging to be turned on.
00036 //
00037 // jhrg 7/25/94
00038 
00039 #include "config_dap.h"
00040 
00041 static char rcsid[] not_used = {"$Id$"};
00042 
00043 #include <string>
00044 #include <GetOpt.h>
00045 
00046 #define YYSTYPE char *
00047 
00048 #include "DAS.h"
00049 #include "das.tab.h"
00050 #include "Error.h"
00051 
00052 #ifdef TRACE_NEW
00053 #include "trace_new.h"
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 void plain_driver(DAS &das, bool deref_alias);
00057 void load_attr_table(AttrTable at);
00058 void load_attr_table_ptr(AttrTable *atp);
00059 void parser_driver(DAS &das, bool deref_alias);
00060 void test_scanner();
00061 
00062 int daslex();
00063 
00064 extern int dasdebug;
00065 const char *prompt = "das-test: ";
00066 const char *version = "version 1.18";
00067 
00068 using namespace std;
00069 
00070 void
00071 usage(string name)
00072 {
00073     fprintf( stderr, "usage: %s %s\n %s\n %s\n %s\n %s\n %s\n %s\n",
00074              name.c_str(),
00075              "[-v] [-s] [-d] [-c] [-p] {< in-file > out-file}",
00076              "s: Test the DAS scanner.",
00077              "p: Scan and parse from <in-file>; print to <out-file>.",
00078              "c: Test building the DAS from C++ code.",
00079              "v: Print the version of das-test and exit.",
00080              "d: Print parser debugging information.",
00081              "r: Print the DAS with aliases deReferenced." ) ;
00082 }
00083 
00084 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00085 {
00086 
00087     GetOpt getopt (argc, argv, "scpvdr");
00088     int option_char;
00089     bool parser_test = false;
00090     bool scanner_test = false;
00091     bool code_test = false;
00092     bool deref_alias = false;
00093     while ((option_char = getopt ()) != EOF)
00094     switch (option_char)
00095       {
00096         case 'p':
00097           parser_test = true;
00098           break;
00099         case 's':
00100           scanner_test = true;
00101           break;
00102         case 'c':
00103           code_test = true;
00104           break;
00105         case 'v':
00106           fprintf( stderr, "%s: %s\n", argv[0], version ) ;
00107           exit(0);
00108         case 'd':
00109           dasdebug = 1;
00110           break;
00111         case 'r':
00112           deref_alias = true;
00113           break;
00114         case '?': 
00115         default:
00116           usage(argv[0]);
00117           exit(1);
00118       }
00119 
00120     DAS das;
00121 
00122     if (!parser_test && !scanner_test && !code_test) {
00123     usage(argv[0]);
00124     exit(1);
00125     }
00126     
00127     try {
00128       if (parser_test)
00129     parser_driver(das, deref_alias);
00130 
00131       if (scanner_test)
00132     test_scanner();
00133 
00134       if (code_test)
00135     plain_driver(das, deref_alias);
00136     }
00137     catch (Error &e) {
00138     cerr << "Caught Error object:" << endl;
00139     cerr << e.get_error_message() << endl;
00140     return 1;
00141     }
00142 
00143     return 0;
00144 }
00145 
00146 void
00147 test_scanner()
00148 {
00149     int tok;
00150 
00151     fprintf( stdout, "%s", prompt ) ; // first prompt
00152     fflush( stdout ) ;
00153     while ((tok = daslex())) {
00154     switch (tok) {
00155       case SCAN_ATTR:
00156         fprintf( stdout, "ATTR\n" ) ;
00157         break;
00158       case SCAN_ALIAS:
00159         fprintf( stdout, "ALIAS\n" ) ;
00160         break;
00161       case SCAN_WORD:
00162         fprintf( stdout, "WORD=%s\n", daslval ) ;
00163         break;
00164 
00165       case SCAN_BYTE:
00166         fprintf( stdout, "BYTE\n" ) ;
00167         break;
00168       case SCAN_INT16:
00169         fprintf( stdout, "INT16\n" ) ;
00170         break;
00171       case SCAN_UINT16:
00172         fprintf( stdout, "UINT16\n" ) ;
00173         break;
00174       case SCAN_INT32:
00175         fprintf( stdout, "INT32\n" ) ;
00176         break;
00177       case SCAN_UINT32:
00178         fprintf( stdout, "UINT32\n" ) ;
00179         break;
00180       case SCAN_FLOAT32:
00181         fprintf( stdout, "FLOAT32\n" ) ;
00182         break;
00183       case SCAN_FLOAT64:
00184         fprintf( stdout, "FLOAT64\n" ) ;
00185         break;
00186       case SCAN_STRING:
00187         fprintf( stdout, "STRING\n" ) ;
00188         break;
00189       case SCAN_URL:
00190         fprintf( stdout, "URL\n" ) ;
00191         break;
00192 
00193       case '{':
00194         fprintf( stdout, "Left Brace\n" ) ;
00195         break;
00196       case '}':
00197         fprintf( stdout, "Right Brace\n" ) ;
00198         break;
00199       case ';':
00200         fprintf( stdout, "Semicolon\n" ) ;
00201         break;
00202       case ',':
00203         fprintf( stdout, "Comma\n" ) ;
00204         break;
00205 
00206       default:
00207         fprintf( stdout, "Error: Unrecognized input\n" ) ;
00208     }
00209     fprintf( stdout, "%s", prompt ) ; // print prompt after output
00210     fflush( stdout ) ;
00211     }
00212 }
00213 
00214 
00215 void
00216 parser_driver(DAS &das, bool deref_alias)
00217 {
00218     das.parse();
00219 
00220     das.print(stdout, deref_alias);
00221 }
00222 
00223 // Given a DAS, add some stuff to it.
00224 
00225 void
00226 plain_driver(DAS &das, bool deref_alias)
00227 {
00228     AttrTable *atp;
00229     AttrTable *dummy;
00230 
00231     string name = "test";
00232     atp = new AttrTable;
00233     load_attr_table_ptr(atp);
00234     dummy = das.get_table(name);
00235     das.add_table(name, atp);
00236 
00237     name = "test2";
00238     atp = new AttrTable;
00239     load_attr_table_ptr(atp);
00240     das.add_table(name, atp);
00241 
00242     das.print(stdout, deref_alias);
00243 }
00244 
00245 // stuff an AttrTable full of values. Also, print it out.
00246 
00247 void
00248 load_attr_table(AttrTable at)
00249 {
00250     at.append_attr("month", "String", "Feb");
00251     at.append_attr("month", "String", "Feb");
00252 
00253     at.append_attr("month_a", "String", "Jan");
00254     at.append_attr("month_a", "String", "Feb");
00255     at.append_attr("month_a", "String", "Mar");
00256 
00257     at.append_attr("Date", "Int32", "12345");
00258     at.append_attr("day", "Int32", "01");
00259     at.append_attr("Time", "Float64", "3.1415");
00260 
00261     fprintf( stdout, "Using the Pix:\n" ) ;
00262     for (Pix p1 = at.first_attr(); p1; at.next_attr(p1))
00263     {
00264         fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at.get_name(p1).c_str(),
00265                    at.get_type(p1).c_str() ) ;
00266         for (unsigned i = 0; i < at.get_attr_num(p1); ++i)
00267                 fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at.get_attr(p1, i).c_str() ) ;
00268         fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00269     }
00270 
00271     fprintf( stdout, "Using the iterator:\n" ) ;
00272     for (AttrTable::Attr_iter p2 = at.attr_begin(); p2 != at.attr_end(); p2++)
00273     {
00274         fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at.get_name(p2).c_str(),
00275             at.get_type(p2).c_str() ) ;
00276         for (unsigned i = 0; i < at.get_attr_num(p2); ++i)
00277             fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at.get_attr(p2, i).c_str() ) ;
00278         fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00279     }
00280 
00281     string name = "month";
00282     fprintf( stdout, "Using String: %s %s %s\n",
00283              at.get_type(name).c_str(),
00284              at.get_attr(name, 0).c_str(),
00285              at.get_attr(name, 1).c_str()) ;
00286     fprintf( stdout, "Using char *: %s %s %s\n",
00287              at.get_type("month").c_str(),
00288              at.get_attr("month", 0).c_str(),
00289              at.get_attr("month", 1).c_str() ) ;
00290 
00291     at.del_attr("month");
00292 
00293     fprintf( stdout, "After deletion:\n" ) ;
00294     for (AttrTable::Attr_iter p3 = at.attr_begin(); p3 != at.attr_end(); p3++)
00295     {
00296         fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at.get_name(p3).c_str(),
00297             at.get_type(p3).c_str() ) ;
00298         for (unsigned i = 0; i < at.get_attr_num(p3); ++i)
00299             fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at.get_attr(p3, i).c_str() ) ;
00300         fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00301     }
00302 
00303     at.print(stdout);
00304 
00305     fprintf( stdout, "After print:\n" ) ;
00306     for (AttrTable::Attr_iter p4 = at.attr_begin(); p4 != at.attr_end(); p4++)
00307     {
00308     fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at.get_name(p4).c_str(),
00309         at.get_type(p4).c_str() ) ;
00310     for (unsigned i = 0; i < at.get_attr_num(p4); ++i)
00311          fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at.get_attr(p4, i).c_str() ) ;
00312     fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00313     }
00314 }
00315 
00316 // OK, now try it with a dymanic AttrTable
00317 
00318 void
00319 load_attr_table_ptr(AttrTable *at)
00320 {
00321     at->append_attr("month", "String", "Feb");
00322     at->append_attr("month", "String", "Feb");
00323 
00324     at->append_attr("month_a", "String", "Jan");
00325     at->append_attr("month_a", "String", "Feb");
00326     at->append_attr("month_a", "String", "Mar");
00327 
00328     at->append_attr("Date", "Int32", "12345");
00329     at->append_attr("day", "Int32", "01");
00330     at->append_attr("Time", "Float64", "3.1415");
00331 
00332     fprintf( stdout, "Using the Pix:\n" ) ;
00333     for (Pix p1 = at->first_attr(); p1; at->next_attr(p1))
00334     {
00335     fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at->get_name(p1).c_str(),
00336                    at->get_type(p1).c_str() ) ;
00337     for (unsigned i = 0; i < at->get_attr_num(p1); ++i)
00338          fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at->get_attr(p1, i).c_str() ) ;
00339     fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00340     }
00341 
00342     fprintf( stdout, "Using the iterator:\n" ) ;
00343     for (AttrTable::Attr_iter p2 = at->attr_begin(); p2 != at->attr_end(); p2++)
00344     {
00345         fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at->get_name(p2).c_str(),
00346             at->get_type(p2).c_str() ) ;
00347         for (unsigned i = 0; i < at->get_attr_num(p2); ++i)
00348             fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at->get_attr(p2, i).c_str() ) ;
00349         fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00350     }
00351 
00352     string name = "month";
00353     fprintf( stdout, "Using String: %s %s %s\n",
00354              at->get_type(name).c_str(),
00355              at->get_attr(name, 0).c_str(),
00356              at->get_attr(name, 1).c_str() ) ;
00357     fprintf( stdout, "Using char *: %s %s %s\n",
00358              at->get_type("month").c_str(),
00359              at->get_attr("month", 0).c_str(),
00360              at->get_attr("month", 1).c_str() ) ;
00361 
00362     at->del_attr("month");
00363 
00364     fprintf( stdout, "After deletion:\n" ) ;
00365     for (AttrTable::Attr_iter p3 = at->attr_begin(); p3 != at->attr_end(); p3++)
00366     {
00367         fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at->get_name(p3).c_str(),
00368             at->get_type(p3).c_str() ) ;
00369         for (unsigned i = 0; i < at->get_attr_num(p3); ++i)
00370             fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at->get_attr(p3, i).c_str() ) ;
00371         fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00372     }
00373 
00374     at->print(stdout);
00375 
00376     fprintf( stdout, "After print:\n" ) ;
00377     for (AttrTable::Attr_iter p4 = at->attr_begin(); p4 !=at->attr_end(); p4++)
00378     {
00379         fprintf( stdout, "%s %s ", at->get_name(p4).c_str(), 
00380             at->get_type(p4).c_str() ) ;
00381         for (unsigned i = 0; i < at->get_attr_num(p4); ++i)
00382             fprintf( stdout, "%s ", at->get_attr(p4, i).c_str() ) ;
00383         fprintf( stdout, "\n" ) ;
00384     }
00385 }

00436 // class vector<>. To maintain use of Pix, changed the Pix.h header file to
00437 // redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00438 // outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods
00439 // to the different classes where Pix is used to include methods to use STL
00440 // iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.

00444 // Revision 1.29  2002/06/03 22:21:15  jimg
00445 // Merged with release-3-2-9
00446 //
00447 // Revision 1.26.4.3  2001/11/01 00:43:51  jimg
00448 // Fixes to the scanners and parsers so that dataset variable names may
00449 // start with digits. I've expanded the set of characters that may appear
00450 // in a variable name and made it so that all except `#' may appear at
00451 // the start. Some characters are not allowed in variables that appear in
00452 // a DDS or CE while they are allowed in the DAS. This makes it possible
00453 // to define containers with names like `COARDS:long_name.' Putting a colon
00454 // in a variable name makes the CE parser much more complex. Since the set
00455 // of characters that people want seems pretty limited (compared to the
00456 // complete ASCII set) I think this is an OK approach. If we have to open
00457 // up the expr.lex scanner completely, then we can but not without adding
00458 // lots of action clauses to teh parser. Note that colon is just an example,
00459 // there's a host of characters that are used in CEs that are not allowed
00460 // in IDs.
00461 //

00484 // Revision 1.25  2000/09/21 16:22:09  jimg
00485 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00486 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00487 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00488 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00489 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00490 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
